abstract: DealBook Online; First Eagle Investment Management reaches $40 million with Securities and Exchange Commission on charges that it used mutual fund assets to pay marketing expenses; case is first to be brought under so-called Distribution-in-Guise Initiative.
lead_paragraph: The case was the first brought against an asset manager under the S.E.C.’s Distribution-in-Guise Initiative, which aims to protect mutual fund shareholders.

headline.main: S.E.C. and First Eagle Investment Reach $40 Million Settlement

snippet: The case was the first brought against an asset manager under the S.E.C.’s Distribution-in-Guise Initiative, which aims to protect mutual fund shareholders.
